ai-tika-vin04t2:2_0: Together with a Buddha, the Dhamma and the Saṅgha,
ai-tika-vin04t2:3_0: worshipping, worshipping, and worshipping the victors,
ai-tika-vin04t2:4_0: by one who spends the drums on the Elder’s professions
ai-tika-vin04t2:5_0: Wirling away, rising from the Noble Truth,
ai-tika-vin04t2:6_0: which is blameless, (and therefore) whatever things are blameless,
ai-tika-vin04t2:7_0: explained by the deception of the Monastic Code on the mouth,
ai-tika-vin04t2:8_0: having a fine cast costly covered with fine deer,
ai-tika-vin04t2:9_0: Suppiya because of his conduct, begged the Elder Nuns’ son,
ai-tika-vin04t2:10_0: There he praised the mendicants in that place.
ai-tika-vin04t2:12_0: The residents of the Mahāvihāra monastery
ai-tika-vin04t2:13_0: I will speak called one who has no doubts or has reached (him) with doubt.
